title: E2E MOCKED PRE-EXISTING Chinese Bacon and Egg Fried Rice
description: This Chinese-inspired dish is a delicious and easy way to use up leftover rice. The salty bacon and creamy eggs add a rich flavor to the dish.
method: Heat a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add the diced bacon and cook until crispy, about 5 minutes.
Remove the bacon from the pan and set aside. Drain off all but 1 tablespoon of the bacon grease.
Add the beaten eggs to the skillet and scramble until cooked through. Remove the eggs from the pan and set aside.
Add the chilled rice to the skillet and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, until heated through.
Add the frozen peas, sliced green onions, and cooked bacon to the skillet. Stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes, until the peas are cooked through.
Add the scrambled eggs to the skillet and stir-fry for another minute.
Drizzle soy sauce over the rice and stir-fry for another minute.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
